result.execSummary:
The defendant Desiree R Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 09/11/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-4
*9/11/2015  Court found no further review is needed.

miscConds.notes:
AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's, during period of probation or civil judgment.
- Restitution is set at zero.
- No firearms/weapons. No knives out of kitchen. 48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continue programming.
- Attend and complete parenting classes.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. (wants treatment). No drugs. No alcohol.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Contact with victim, Lillie R., agent can amend to No Violent Contact if defendant is doing well in BIP and maintaining sobriety.
 Three steps:
- - 1: See kids with 3rd party.
- - 2: No violence with victim and non residential contact.
- - 3: Residential contact with agent approval.
- May see children with 3rd party adult, not the victim.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

records.addlTxt: To conform to entry of 9/11/15 only.

Defendant Desiree R Taylor in court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch

Defendant Desiree R Taylor in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Received in writing and filed:  Probation Status Report from Amy McBride Schmidt
probation/parole agent. ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.

Defendant Desiree R Taylor in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT #1: Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #2), in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.  

AS TO COUNT #2: Defendant sentenced to serve 3 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #1), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  (wants treatment).
   No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Lillie R., agent can amend to no violent 
   contact if defendant is doing well in BIP and maintaining sobriety.  
   Three steps: 
    -- 1: see kids with 3rd party; 
    -- 2: No violence with victim and non residential contact; 
    -- 3: Residential contact with agent approval.   
* May see children with 3rd party adult, not the victim.  
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.  No knives out of kitchen.  
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero. 
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 9-11-2015 AT 1:30 PM. 
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   
EFFECTIVE AUGUST 3, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE ASSIGNED TO THE HON. JEFFREY WAGNER, BRANCH 38, IN ROOM 504 OF THE COURTHOUSE.  mld

Defendant Desiree R. Taylor in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Defense is currently waiting for additional discovery from the State.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-24-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Defendant Desiree R Taylor in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered the penalty enhancer on Count 1 striken.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to both counts and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged on Counts 1 and 2 and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Desiree R Taylor in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-22-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Defendant Desiree R Taylor in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Upon the request of defense counsel, case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-12-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: LILLIE R.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Desiree R Taylor in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  
Defendant Desiree R Taylor in custody.  
William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
